intro: Galium gracile, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically features slender, prostrate stems that are often hairy and produce small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly serrated margin. Galium gracile thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
